intro: Astragalus sandalaschensis, commonly known as the sandalasch milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across dry landscapes.
